refnamediv.refpurpose: generates media listings in XML and other formats

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: &jmlist; scans one or more directories for media files (currently only audio files) and generates a &a.xml; listing of the whole directory tree with information about each media file such as filesize, song length, title, author, album, etc. A &a.xsl; stylesheet can be applied to the output to transform into a different output, like tabular or tree listings in plain text, &a.xml;, &a.html;, &a.rdf;, &a.rss; or any other &a.xml; format.

&jmlist; should be invoked by passing one or more directory paths on its command line. For each directory passed, it will be scanned recursively for media files. Each file whose extension is known to &jmlist; is parsed in order to extract information about its content type and length, and tagged meta-information.

Apply a stylesheet to the output. This is the option you should use to get some useable output from &jmlist;. If you omit this option, &jmlist; will output a raw &a.xml; tree. Available style names are listed by the --list-styles option.

Stylesheets are &a.xsl; Tranform files that transforms the raw &a.xml; tree generated by &jmlist; into another different, either text or markup, document. Some stylesheets are provided along with &jmlist;, and you can write your own ones and install them on your user style directory.
If there are stylesheets with the same name installed on both user and system directories, the ones on your user directory take precedence.
